messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1498
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/22/01 8:56:28 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:  .  Is there a parralel world ... I have heard,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/22/01 8:56:28 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< > . Is there a parralel world
> filled with beings somehow making use of all the OTHER
>

I have heard, but will never know for sure, I guess, that they turn into
something. Paper clips?

And then paper clips turn into coat hangers.

Sometimes there are LOTS of paper clips and sometimes none, and then there
will be wire coat hangers you've never seen before.

I think that evolution leads to ballpoint pens, and ballpoint pens escape
the
house.

>>


The Borrowers. My pizza cutter is missing dd thinks the borrowers took it.

NICKI~ who bets she finds it indd's room when we move.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1498
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/22/2001 9:56:28 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/22/2001 9:56:28 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
Any other suggestions? Remember, she is carrying everything on her back, so
space is an obvious limitation. >>

Hi, Susan! Long time no see! :-) What occurrred to me (if it's allowed
on the trains) are bubbles, "pretty bubbles in the air" <g>...Could she get
some *very* concentrated soap liquid (for refills) and one bubble-blowing
setup w/small container and wand? Looks of "down time" could be filled
watching bubbles float across the parkinglots outside the stations (if kids
can't do this inside, due to regulations).

Another idea: the book __Cat's Cradle__ (put out by Klutz Press) comes
complete with string and *easy* instructions for all those yarn/finger games
you may have done as a child.

Becky in Iowa

*** Becky***

"Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and
conscientious stupidity."

Martin Luther King Jr. (1929 - 1968), Strength to Love, 1963

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1498
messages.msgSnippet: I love this idea!  Our local library has several books fro string figures...bet yours does, too! S ... she ... how ... surprised
messages.messageBody:
I love this idea! Our local library has several books fro string
figures...bet yours does, too!
S
> My sister uses string figures, like Cat's Cradle, to relate to children
she
> meets. All you need is the right length of string and the knowledge of
how
> to do them. I've seen books on string figures, and I wouldn't be
surprised
> if you could find something on the web.
> Tia
